page.title: 01GLEN ROSA TO GLEN SHURIG
page.content: At the bottom of Glen Rosa the valley floor is broad and flat, and so it is used as a campsite. However because the water level in the burn rises very rapidly, the campsite is easily flooded during wet weather. Further up the glen is the Garbg Alt waterfall. There is a small dam in the burn, and this is the main water supply for Brodick, the water being piped away. The land north of Glenrosa water and the Garbh Alt is owned by the National Trust for Scotland. Glen Shurig runs across the south of this area, and on the south side of the glen is the string road, running from Brodick to Blackwaterfoot. There are a few houses in the lower part of the glen. The western area is moorland which is wet and boggy in places. Part of the area is a site of special scientific interest.
